title: 113_s61
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "SHORT TITLE; DEFINITIONS." The Act is titled the "California Coastal National Monument Expansion Act of 2013" and defines key terms such as "map," "Monument," "Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands," and "Presidential Proclamation 7264." Proclamation Number 7264, dated January 11, 2000, defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Secretary" is defined as the Secretary of the Interior. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands contain significant natural resources, including wildlife habitat, wetlands, and coastal ecosystems that support marine wildlife and local economies. They also hold historical significance for California's coastal prehistory and history. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical significance for Indian tribes and are associated with adjacent land managed for future generations. The lands represent a successful partnership among various government entities and private groups for future management. Permanent protection of the lands will provide important economic benefits. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical significance for Indian tribes and are associated with adjacent land managed for future generations. The lands represent a successful partnership among various government entities and private groups for future management. Permanent protection of the lands will provide important economic benefits and has broad public support. The purpose of this Act is to protect, conserve, and enhance the unique and nationally important historical, natural, cultural, scientific, educational, scenic, and recreational values of the Point. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical significance for Indian tribes and are associated with adjacent land managed for future generations. The purpose of this Act is to protect, conserve, and enhance the unique and nationally important scientific, educational, scenic, and recreational values of the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands, while allowing certain recreational and research activities to continue. Expansion of California Coastal National Monument. Expansion of California Coastal National Monument. The boundary of the Monument established by Presidential Proclamation 7264 is expanded to include Federal land shown on a map. The Secretary will file a map and boundary description with Congress, which will have the same force and effect as the Act, with the ability to correct minor errors. The boundary description for the expanded California Coastal National Monument will be filed with the Bureau of Land Management for public inspection. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary will manage the land added to the Monument in accordance with Presidential Proclamation 7264 and finalize a management plan within 2 years for long-term protection. The plan will involve public participation and outline appropriate land uses. Motorized transport will only be allowed for emergencies or authorized purposes. The Secretary will manage the land added to the Monument in accordance with Presidential Proclamation 7264. Motorized vehicles in the Monument are permitted only on designated roads and trails. Non-Federal land may be acquired through exchange, donation, or purchase for Monument expansion. Overflights, including low-level flights, are not restricted by this Act. The Act restricts new special use airspace units and military flight training routes over the Monument. It also does not affect Department of Homeland Security law enforcement authorities or Native American rights. Buffer zones are established for the Monument expansion. The Monument expansion does not establish protective perimeters or buffer zones. Activities outside the Monument are not precluded, grazing of livestock is unaffected, and the Monument is managed as part of the National Landscape Conservation System.
